intro: Tectona theca, commonly known as the white teak, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, Thailand, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. The botanical features of Tectona theca make it an important plant in traditional medicine and horticulture.
